explanation: Total CO2e emissions are calculated based on a life cycle assessment approach, following GHG Protocol Product Standard, ISO 14040/14044, PAS 2050, and ISO/TS 14067 guidelines. The provided manufacturing emissions are 350 kg CO2e. To estimate the total footprint, we've included upstream material extraction and processing, transportation and distribution, and end-of-life disposal. Material extraction and processing is estimated to contribute approximately 75% of manufacturing emissions, accounting for the energy-intensive nature of aluminum and other materials (estimated at 262.5 kg CO2e). Transportation and distribution are estimated at 15 kg CO2e, considering global supply chains. End-of-life disposal is estimated at 7.5% of manufacturing emissions (estimated at 26.25 kg CO2e). Summing these stages: 262.5 kg CO2e (Material Extraction & Processing) + 350 kg CO2e (Manufacturing) + 15 kg CO2e (Transportation & Distribution) + 26.25 kg CO2e (End-of-life Disposal) = 653.75 kg CO2e. These are estimations based on typical life cycle stages for electronic products and are indicative. Actual values may vary depending on specific supply chains, transportation distances, and end-of-life management scenarios. This calculation provides a comprehensive, though estimated, carbon footprint across the product's life cycle stages as per LCA methodologies.

Assuming an approximate weight of 1.61 kg for a MacBook Pro 14-inch (common specification), the manufacturing emissions are calculated as 65 kg CO2e/kg * 1.61 kg = 104.65 kg CO2e. A complete life cycle assessment following PAS 2050 and ISO/TS 14067 would also include emissions from material extraction and processing, transportation and distribution, and end-of-life disposal (Scope 3), which are not provided in the input data and therefore not included in this calculation. Thus, this value represents a partial carbon footprint focusing solely on the manufacturing stage.
